intro: Hieracium stenotricum, commonly known as the narrow-haired hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of tubular and ray florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, with basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow, appearing in clusters, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium stenotricum is often found in grassy areas, meadows, and disturbed soils, and it is considered a common weed in agricultural settings.
